page.title: 05An Oxfordshire Farmer.
page.content: Mr. Caudwell has been farming Oxfordshire land all his life as did his father and his father before him. {He is a farmer who believes in looking {after the countryside.}Instead of ripping out hedges and creating a dust-bowl he is replanting blackthorn and whitethorn hedges. He explained that economically it makes more sense to plant a hedge which might have a lifespan of 100 years as against erecting barbed wire fencing which only lasts for approximately 20 years. Mr. Caudwell is aware that he must get the maximum return for every acre planted and to ensure this is the case he spends Â£60,000 a year on chemical fertilisers and pesticides. Mr. Caudwell is a modern farmer. We could tell this because in his office there was a computer. This is used for keeping records of livestock and crops
